name: Hampton Inn Mount Dora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night while traveling. Rooms were spacious, clean, & comfortable. The morning breakfast was adequate, although not the best I have had at similar hotels. This location was very convenient to several nice restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: Comfortable & Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The title of this review says it all - Hampton Inns are reliable hotels. The room was clean, quiet and served as a great place to stay for one night when you're on your way to some place else. Would I spend a few nights here? No - it's not a vacation spot, but it serves its purpose for the road-weary traveler who just needs a good place to sleep. The breakfast was self-serve with boxed cereals etc - but with good coffee and newspapers. And the counter person was polite and helpful. And it was extremely reasonable!
reviews.title: Another Reliable Hampton Inn

reviews.text: It's just a short drive down the road to the village of Mt. Dora, a place I've always wanted to visit. It's quaint with good restaurants and a few upscale boutiques - a nice place to spend the day.
reviews.title: Served my purpose

reviews.text: Although this is not one of the newer Hampton Inns I've stayed in, it was certainly fine for me. It was clean and comfortable. They were flexible enough to allow me to check in early after I offered to change my room type. The location is just several minutes outside downtown Mt. Dora. It's right across the road from Mt. Dora Country Club. They varied the breakfast choices nicely from day to day. I felt safe there traveling alone and liked the option of the side entrance (closer to my room) when lugging all my golf gear. This particular door was only accessible by room key at all times.
reviews.title: Run.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lock up all you belonging...the maid service will steal from you. Even though is was small management did nothing. Little thing lead to bigger stealing.... Go stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Stayed here many times

likes.liked: — It's extra clean at a great price.

reviews.title: My colleague & I were missing personal items from our room.
reviews.text: Although we had a comfortable stay as it relates to the cleanliness of the hotel, my colleague and I were dissappointed to realize that we were missing personal items that we knew we left in the room. The hotel personnel was unhelpful in trying to locate or even ask their workers about the missing items. Needless to say, this was quite upsetting to us. We will not be returning to this hotel.

I've stayed at this Hampton Inn in Mt. Dora overall for the last five years and found it to be well maintained and clean. Sheila the front office person is a delight and helpful during my last two visits. This hotel is convenient to my place of business while visiting from out of state and is conveniently located to an excellent Japenese sushi place (Luampur) just down Hwy 441.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has accomodated me during all my stays, and I've had no problems, and would gladly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in need of a major facelift. The property is worn and dated. As the only hotel in Mount Dora (aside from B&B's and the like), Hampton Inn would be well advised to update it to bring it in line with their Leesburg property. In addition to the 'sad' state of the hotel (rooms included), the front desk guy was oddly curt with us and left me thinking he wasn't suited to a job in the service industry (in addition to which he was eyeing his cellphone, which was positioned next to the computer, the entire time we were standing at the front desk talking to him).
reviews.title: Nice Enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rely on Hampton Inns to always be clean, relatively well appointed, comfortable, and friendly. This one falls short on all fronts.
reviews.title: GREAT VALUE CLEAN ROOM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Mt. Dora & although the Chamber of Commerce recommended the many bed & breakfasts in the area we felt more secure staying at a Hampton Inn (especially not knowing the area). The location was perfect. It was close to Renningers & close to the town. The only negative was that when driving on 441(the first time) it was not lit up sufficiently & we passed it & had to u-turn (not a big deal). The room was clean with a big flat screen TV & the breakfast was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel & Friendly Staff

reviews.text: We always stay here when we visit Mt. Dora! Nice property, nice location, & most of all, nice staff. The manager, Barry, recognizes us & always speaks to us. We like to bring our boat to cruise these nice lakes, & especially the Dora Canal, & we feel secure leaving it in the parking lot here. We stay here 4-5 times a year, & always look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: We are regulars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights this past weekend at this hotel. We were up in the area to do some shopping in Mt. Dora and nearby Renningers. It had been years since we had been to this area, and in previous visits had stayed at B&B's and at the Lakeside Inn. We were not overly impressed with any of these previous choices, especially for the price, so decided to give the Hampton Inn a visit. I have stayed at Hampton Inn's in other locations and knew what to expect.
reviews.title: Just as I expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And I got exactly what I expected from a Hampton Inn: a clean comfortable room, more than adequate breakfast, value pricing, and friendly service.
reviews.title: Great value and nice location

reviews.text: The room is nice sized with a closet, flat screen tv, free internet, clean sufficient bathroom, and very comfortable king sized bed. The breakfast buffet, although not high end, was more than sufficient; I am not a big breakfast eater, but because of all the choices (fresh fruit, variety of breads, cereals, hot eggs and sausage and waffles, donuts and muffins, etc.) I actually ate a big meal both mornings. The pricing was less than a stay in a small bedroom in the nearby B&B's, and in my opinion with much more value and amenities than a B&B. Everyone on staff who I encountered were polite and had a smile on their face. Although a bit chilly (for us Floridians) to use the pool, the hot tub was big, clean and.....hot! We took full advantage.
reviews.title: Great Place- Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Stayed here due to location as we were visiting friends. The hotel is the older version of the Hampton Inn. Rooms are small with old furniture and very little room. Beds had fresh linens and comfy beds. The room was very clean and all the staff was friendly. Not the best Hampton I have stayed in, but it was adequate. Breakfast was a let down didnt seem like they had very much.
reviews.title: Just Fine

reviews.text: From the moment I spoke to the person who took my reservation to the minute I checked out everything was great. The room was immaculate with a comfortable bed and wonderful amenities. I was skeptical about the advertised "hot breakfast" but was pleasantly surprised. It featured scrambled eggs, turkey sausage, and potatos. It even included a waffle iron to make fresh waffles, fruits, yogurt and the list goes on and on. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, going as far as booking me a room at my next destination. This is a wonderful hotel. I plan on returning and recommend it to anyone and everyone.
reviews.title: From the moment I spoke to the person who...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a music festival in the area and liked the Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just what we expected, clean, good breakfast, easy to find and the price was right. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Should be a 3 star
very clean and tidy
reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Hampton Inn, I am not sure what room the reviewer below me was staying in, but I was in room 102 and it was clean, quiet and for the price of $80/night you could not beat it. I checked prices in downtown Mt. Dora and they were $120 to $150, stopped by the Lakeside Inn and the musty smell almost make me throwup. The Hampton Inn is a 2.5 mile drive to downtown Mt. Dora, very good breakfast, eggs, potatoes, turkey sausage, cereal, fruit, waffles, pastries, etc., and good coffee. I would give this hotel 3 stars and would stay there again.

aka: Hampton Inn Mount Dora Hotel Mount Dora
